intro: Ridolfia, commonly known as the golden crown or Indian crown, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers that resemble a crown, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Ridolfia species have lance-shaped leaves and produce small, tubular flowers that are clustered in a head. These plants are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant and unique appearance.
